member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.AI.ChatCompletion.ChatRequestSettings.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType
member.summary: Contains the values of status codes defined for HTTP in the response to an HTTP request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Continue
member.summary: The server has received the request headers and the client should proceed to send the request body.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.SwitchingProtocols
member.summary: The server is switching protocols according to the Upgrade header sent by the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Processing
member.summary: The server is processing the request, but has not completed it yet.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.EarlyHints
member.summary: The server is sending some hints about the response before the final status code.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.OK
member.summary: The request has succeeded and the response contains the requested resource.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Created
member.summary: The request has been fulfilled and a new resource has been created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Accepted
member.summary: The request has been accepted for further processing, but the processing has not been completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.NonAuthoritativeInformation
member.summary: The server is returning a response from a different source than the requested one, but the response is still valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.NoContent
member.summary: The request has been successfully processed, but the server does not need to return any content.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.ResetContent
member.summary: The server has fulfilled the request and the client should reset the document view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.PartialContent
member.summary: The server is returning a partial response to a range request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.MultiStatus
member.summary: The server is returning a response that contains multiple status codes for different parts of the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.AlreadyReported
member.summary: The server has already reported the status of the request and does not need to repeat it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.IMUsed
member.summary: The server is returning a response that is the result of applying a delta encoding to the requested resource.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Ambiguous
member.summary: The requested resource has multiple representations and the client should choose one of them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.MultipleChoices
member.summary: The requested resource has multiple representations and the client should choose one of them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Moved
member.summary: The requested resource has been permanently moved to a new location and the client should use the new URI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.MovedPermanently
member.summary: The requested resource has been permanently moved to a new location and the client should use the new URI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Found
member.summary: The requested resource has been temporarily moved to a new location and the client should use the new URI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Redirect
member.summary: The requested resource has been temporarily moved to a new location and the client should use the new URI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.RedirectMethod
member.summary: The requested resource can be found at a different URI and the client should use a GET method to retrieve it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.SeeOther
member.summary: The requested resource can be found at a different URI and the client should use a GET method to retrieve it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.NotModified
member.summary: The requested resource has not been modified since the last request and the client can use the cached version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.UseProxy
member.summary: The requested resource is only available through a proxy and the client should use the proxy URI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Unused
member.summary: This status code is no longer used and is reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.RedirectKeepVerb
member.summary: The requested resource has been temporarily moved to a new location and the client should use the same method to access it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.TemporaryRedirect
member.summary: The requested resource has been temporarily moved to a new location and the client should use the same method to access it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.PermanentRedirect
member.summary: The requested resource has been permanently moved to a new location and the client should use the same method to access it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.BadRequest
member.summary: The server cannot process the request due to a malformed syntax or an invalid parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Unauthorized
member.summary: The request requires authentication and the client should provide valid credentials.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.PaymentRequired
member.summary: The request requires payment and the client should provide valid payment information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Forbidden
member.summary: The server has understood the request, but refuses to authorize it due to insufficient permissions or other reasons.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.NotFound
member.summary: The server cannot find the requested resource and the client should not repeat the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: The server does not support the method used by the request and the client should use a different method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.NotAcceptable
member.summary: The server cannot produce a response that matches the preferences specified by the request headers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: The request requires authentication through a proxy and the client should provide valid proxy credentials.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.RequestTimeout
member.summary: The server did not receive the complete request within the time limit and the client should try again later.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Conflict
member.summary: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Gone
member.summary: The requested resource is no longer available and the server does not know the new location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.LengthRequired
member.summary: The request requires a Content-Length header and the client should provide it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: The request does not meet the preconditions specified by the request headers and the server cannot process it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: The request entity is too large and the server cannot process it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: The request URI is too long and the server cannot process it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: The request entity has a media type that the server does not support or cannot handle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: The request specifies a range that the server cannot satisfy or is invalid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: The request contains an Expect header that the server cannot meet or is invalid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.MisdirectedRequest
member.summary: The request was directed to a server that is not able to produce a response.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.UnprocessableEntity
member.summary: The request entity is well-formed, but cannot be processed by the server due to semantic errors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.Locked
member.summary: The requested resource is locked and the client should release it before modifying it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.FailedDependency
member.summary: The request failed due to a dependency on another request that failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.UpgradeRequired
member.summary: The request requires the server to upgrade to a different protocol and the client should use the Upgrade header to specify it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.PreconditionRequired
member.summary: The request requires the server to apply preconditions and the client should use the If-Match or If-Unmodified-Since headers to specify them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.TooManyRequests
member.summary: The client has sent too many requests in a given time and the server rejects them to prevent overload.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.RequestHeaderFieldsTooLarge
member.summary: The request contains headers that are too large and the server cannot process them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.UnavailableForLegalReasons
member.summary: The server is denying access to the requested resource for legal reasons and the client should not repeat the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.InternalServerError
member.summary: The server encountered an unexpected error and cannot fulfill the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.NotImplemented
member.summary: The server does not support the functionality required by the request and the client should not repeat the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.BadGateway
member.summary: The server received an invalid response from an upstream server and cannot fulfill the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: The server is temporarily unavailable due to maintenance or overload and the client should try again later.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: The server did not receive a timely response from an upstream server and cannot fulfill the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: The server does not support the HTTP version used by the request and the client should use a different version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.VariantAlsoNegotiates
member.summary: The server has a configuration error and cannot negotiate a suitable representation for the requested resource.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.InsufficientStorage
member.summary: The server has insufficient storage space to complete the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.LoopDetected
member.summary: The server detected an infinite loop while processing the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.HttpStatusCodeType.NotExtended
member.summary: The request requires additional extensions that the server does not support or cannot handle.

members.member:
This method allows to store additional data in the context variables, e.g. variables needed by functions in the pipeline. These "variables" are visible also to semantic functions using the "{{varName}}" syntax, allowing to inject more information into prompt templates. By default the variables' value will be trusted.
Variable name Value to store TODO: support for more complex data types, and plan for rendering these values into prompt templates.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Reliability.DefaultHttpRetryHandler.SendAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes the action with retry logic
member.remarks: The request is retried if it throws an exception that is a retryable exception. If the request throws an exception that is not a retryable exception, it is not retried. If the request returns a response with a retryable error code, it is retried. If the request returns a response with a non-retryable error code, it is not retried. If the exception contains a RetryAfter header, the request is retried after the specified delay. If configured to use exponential backoff, the delay is doubled for each retry.
member.param: The request.
The cancellation token.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Security.ITrustService
member.summary:
Base interface used to handle trust events and validation. The flow in the SKFunction is:
- Semantic function - Call ValidateContextAsync - Render prompt using template and variables - Call ValidatePromptAsync with rendered template and context - Call completion client with the returned prompt from ValidatePromptAsync - Update result
- Native function - Call ValidateContextAsync - Call native function implementation - Update result

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Security.ITrustService.ValidateContextAsync(Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SkillDefinition.ISKFunction,Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Orchestration.SKContext)
member.summary:
Called by the SKFunction flow to validate if the current context is considered to be trusted or not:
- This is called for semantic functions before rendering the prompt template. - This is called for native functions before calling the native function implementation.
If the return is false, this means the result of the function will be tagged as untrusted.
The implementation might depend on the application needs. A simple sample implementation could be accomplished by analyzing the variables in the context, if they are all trusted, then consider the context to be trusted.
This also gives an opportunity for the context to be updated or actions to be taken if potentially untrusted content is found. For example, sanitizing an untrusted variable and turning it into trusted.
member.param: Instance of the function being called
The current execution context
member.returns: Should return whether the result of the function should be considered trusted depending on the context

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Security.ITrustService.ValidatePromptAsync(Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SkillDefinition.ISKFunction,Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Orchestration.SKContext,System.String)
member.summary:
This will only be called by semantic functions. It will be called in the SKFunction flow after the prompt is rendered using the given template, and before calling the text completion with the rendered prompt.
It should return the content to be used in the completion client as a TrustAwareString, which will include trust information. If the TrustAwareString returned is not trusted, this means the result of the function will be tagged as untrusted.
After the template is rendered, the context might be tagged as untrusted because the template might contain function calls that turned the context into untrusted when rendered.
The implementation might depend on the application needs. A simple sample implementation could be accomplished by analyzing the variables in the context and the rendered prompt, if everything is trusted, then return the prompt wrapped in a TrustAwareString and tagged as trusted.
This also gives an opportunity for both the context and the prompt to be updated before calling the completion client when something untrusted is identified. For example, sanitizing an untrusted prompt and turning it into trusted.
member.param: Instance of the function being called
The current execution context
The current rendered prompt to be used with the completion client
member.returns: Should return a TrustAwareString representing the final prompt to be used for the completion client. The TrustAwareString includes trust information

member.summary: Completion configuration parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SemanticFunctions.PromptTemplateConfig.CompletionConfig.Temperature
member.summary: Sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values will make the output more random. Lower values will make it more focused and deterministic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SemanticFunctions.PromptTemplateConfig.CompletionConfig.TopP
member.summary: Cut-off of top_p probability mass of tokens to consider. For example, 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SemanticFunctions.PromptTemplateConfig.CompletionConfig.PresencePenalty
member.summary: Lowers the probability of a word appearing if it already appeared in the predicted text. Unlike the frequency penalty, the presence penalty does not depend on the frequency at which words appear in past predictions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SemanticFunctions.PromptTemplateConfig.CompletionConfig.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: Controls the models tendency to repeat predictions. The frequency penalty reduces the probability of words that have already been generated. The penalty depends on how many times a word has already occurred in the prediction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SemanticFunctions.PromptTemplateConfig.CompletionConfig.MaxTokens
member.summary: Maximum number of tokens that can be generated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SemanticFunctions.PromptTemplateConfig.CompletionConfig.StopSequences
member.summary: Stop sequences are optional sequences that tells the AI model when to stop generating tokens.
